title: Stalin: the power of fear
creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
brief_description: Examines the price of Stalinism in the aftermath of World War II: possibly between forty and eighty million lives lost in wars, starvation, execution, and unnecessary deaths. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary level.
